intro: Inodaphnis lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf daphne, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft texture. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, typically blooming in spring. Its botanical features make it a notable species in both horticultural and ecological studies. The plant prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, thriving in temperate climates.
